intro: Wahlenbergia humifusa, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white, which bloom from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
